newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton rates steady amid dull trade.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton rates steady amid dull trade.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates held steady on Tuesday in dull trading ahead of tomorrow's official strike to protest at what Pakistan says is India's occupation of Moslem-majority Kashmir, dealers said.

"People are in a holiday mood as the market will be shut on Wednesday because of a strike on Kashmir and the coming Eid al-Fitr holidays next week," dealer Kishan Chand said. "Trading is likely to pick up after the Eid holidays."
In the kerb market, NIAB-78 variety ranged between 2,075 ($512.59) rupees per maund (37.32 kg) to 2,100 rupees, he said.
Tuesday's official spot rates issued by the Karachi Cotton Association in rupees per maund including 10 percent sales tax:
